result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindi L. Carrion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court
Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose/make a list any prescriptions prescribed and give to agent immediately.
No direct or indirect contact with Gary & Barb Fix.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.  
Comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
No restitution requested.
No credit if revoked.

records.addlTxt: Blessinger hearing held

This a Blessinger Hearing for a Committment Warrant that was issued for failure to pay fines, fees, or costs that were previously ordered by the Court.  
Court Case(s) #: 15CF235

Defendant appears by video from the jail.
Court questions defendant on jail sentence and conviction in this case.
Defendant makes statement to the Court.
Court advises there was a civil judgment ordered on this case. The debt has been sent to tax intercept.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders the defendant released from jail as the debt was ordered as a civil judgment.
Warrant delivered to dispatch by Court Officer.
Reminder Notice returned

Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. 
Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant to be issued.
Sentencing Hearing on Revocation set for June 1, 2017 at 9:30 a.m.  **per post office insufficient address
Sentence Adjustment Review set for May 30, 2017 at 8:45 a.m. - Not deliverable as addressed

Defendant Cindi L. Carrion in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Cindi L. Carrion in custody. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:35 a.m.  Court calls the case and states the appearances.
This is a continued hearing on a sentence on hearing after revocation from earlier this week.
State has complied with victim notification; the record will reflect that no victim(s) appear in Court today.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing after revocation.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Sentenced to 270 days in county jail
*huber priviliges for work or any counseling she may be involved in
*first half to be in custody and the second half to be served on GPS electronic home monitor, if approved by the jail administration
117 days of jail credit
Court costs to be converted to a civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 1, 2017 at 09:30 am.

9:18 a.m. Defendant Cindi L. Carrion in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State didn't get notified of hearing. Matter rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for June 1, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Atty Erik McFarland
Sentence adjustment review on May 30, 2017 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cindi L. Carrion in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Cindi L. Carrion in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF341 and 15CF235.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 15CF235 - Probation and 15CF341 - jail time/time served
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF235: No Contest
15CF341 Count 4: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty15CF235 and 15CF341 Count 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF341 Count 1, 2, & 3 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with recommendation and states 49 days credit. 

BY THE COURT:*************Probation***
15CF235: Forgery-Uttering PTC
W/H SEntence
3 yrs   Probation
Conditions:
 AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose/list any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
No direct or indirect contact with Gary & Barb Fix.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.  
Comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
No restitution.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
No credit if revoked.

15CF341 Disorderly Conduct:
49 days jail - 49 days credit - time served.
Pay costs + DNA surcharges. Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan.

Appeal rights provided.

Defendant Cindi L. Carrion not in court, in custody in Waupaca County Jail.   Atty Ryan Drengler appeared for defendant, Cindi L Carrion. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF235 and 15CF341.

11:25 a.m.  Atty Constable makes statements that defendant is currently in the Waupaca County Jail.
They were hoping to complete a plea hearing today. 

BY THE COURT:
Plea hearing to be set.
Status conference at 12-21-2015 10:15 am
Pre-trial conference at 11-02-2015 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 09-28-2015 11:15 am

3:05 p.m.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing. cases 15CF235 and 15CF341 both being heard for preliminary and arraignment today.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 09-14-2015 03:00 pm

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
